page.title: 02SAINT ALDHELM'S WELL.
page.content: {St. Aldhelm's Well}is found in a small coppice in the vicarage grounds.The water flows out from under two stone arches which are built into the solid rock.In front of the arches is along narrow channel which is lined by dressed stone.There are signs that the well and channel were once covered by a roofed building.This was believed to have then been used as a bath for pilgrims who went there for the water's reputed healing qualities.A local story says that {St. Aldhelm}did penance there by sitting in the well whilst reciting The Psalter.The spring provides a constant supply of excellent water and has never been known to dry up.The well forms the source of the{River Sheppey,}which in Saxon times was known as{Doulting {River.
